description: The cause of the highlighted issues relates to multiple zero-day vulnerabilities identified in various Microsoft products, specifically within the Windows OS and Microsoft Office. CVE-2024-43491 represents a significant remote code execution vulnerability affecting Windows 10 versions 1507 and 2015 LTSB, rated critical with a CVSS score of 9.8. Potential exploitation of this vulnerability necessitates that organizations apply the latest servicing stack update for mitigation. Another critical vulnerability is identified in Windows Mark of the Web (CVE-2024-38217), allowing security feature bypass, impacting Windows Server 2008 and newer editions. CVE-2024-38014 deals with an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Installer, affecting similar Windows versions, while CVE-2024-38226 pertains to Microsoft Publisher vulnerabilities that could exploit macro policies in Office 2019 and 2021. These vulnerabilities, marked by immediate exploitation and public disclosure, underscore the urgency for administrators to act on the provided patches promptly to safeguard their systems.
